column5: After 20+ years our club makes page 2!  Good job guys  jjcanoe  Thames River Rainbow stocking

way to go JJ, doing simular stuff tommorrow for the FECC, it's the day we drag our walleye rearing pond to get the fry out for stocking.  great stuff to see fellow hardcore anglers give back to our sport

we've been trying secure an egg source for our walleye hatchery for years but can't get approval from the LEMU.  Used to get them from the Dunnville club but all of a sudden the Grand river walleye and the Thames river walleye are a different strain of fish, even though we stocked Grand R fish for years in the Thames  jjcanoe
Congrats to you guys & your club for all the hard work & time you put in for makin g a difference   im sure the fishery has improved because of your efforts !!!!!....cheers to all

Great job guys! By releasing them into the tributary itself, these little guys will imprint and return there to spawn.  I read somewhere that the ministry did the exact opposite by releasing the fingerlings (?) in open water.  Apparently they don't reproduce that way.
Theres only a few cold water stream down here in the banana belt that we can release them in.  Anything above Fanshawe dam or Hunts dam is verboten since these are VHS barriers  jjcanoe
Congrads. Theres nothing better than having more fish.
